wikipedia_page.main: Henry Canova Vollam Morton  (known as H. V. Morton), (26 July 1892 – 18 June 1979) was a journalist and pioneering travel writer from Lancashire, England. He was best known for his many books on London, Great Britain and the Holy Land. He first achieved fame in 1923 when, while working for the Daily Express, he covered the opening of the Tomb of Tutankhamun by Howard Carter.

response: * H. V. Morton (Henry Vollam Morton, 1892–1979), British journalist and travel writer
